ygData.messageBody:
i agree, i would like the level 30 song working. i also agrre that yes
chain is most efficient only when the creature starts to run. from wherever
i got my song list many weeks ago, it said it decreases attack speed, though
i can not say whether this is true or not. if it is, the obvious benefit
over binding is that chain is single target.

Shada Silverleaf, Level 44 Bard, Mithaniel Marr


> -----Original Message-----
> From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> Sent: Sunday, June 13, 1999 12:43 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Quick question re: choices of primary
> & secondary
> weapons
>
>
> From: jhenders@...
>
> On Sun, Jun 13/99, Kyle <ksibbald@...> wrote:
>
> > Now I play Anthem, Chain, and another song.
>
> The problem with this (and I was doing it too) is that Chain
> just slows
> the mob's movement speed from what I can tell, not it's attack speed
> like Binding does. And it doesn't seem to slow the mob's
> movement speed
> that much until the mob is low on hp. It can help keep a very fast mob
> from rushing back and forth to your casters and healers but other than
> that it really doesn't seem that useful in the early phase of combat.
> Later and for nailing down runners it's very effective though so I
> always have it memorized. It can combine well with Screech to
> chase off
> some mobs while keeping one slowly running away while you
> attack it but
> this is only useful in limited situations (do not ever play fear in
> lower guk for instance <g>) Now that it's working, I've been
> using chant
> of flame a bit to see how effective it is. As most of the powerful
> L39-40 wizard spells are ice based it's not as useful as chant of cold
> will be, but if you have a druid in the party it is nice. From what I
> can tell from testing on myself it seems to do DoT of about 30 as well
> as lowering fire resist significantly. I'm hoping they fixed the L30
> song soon so I can see how well that works.
>
